snippet: Though Spurs Coach Gregg Popovich has rested his big three before, he is too smart not to have anticipated the league commissioner David Stern’s reaction this time.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Basketball column contends that clash between NBA commissioner David Stern and San Antonio Spurs coach Gregg Popovich, who was fined $250,000 for resting his best players in nationally televised game against Miami Heat, is at least partly related to Popovich's frustration over Stern's negotiated television deals.
lead_paragraph: Though Spurs Coach Gregg Popovich has rested his big three before, he is too smart not to have anticipated the league commissioner David Stern’s reaction this time.

headline.seo: Gregg Popovich Puts Spurs First, to Commissioner’s Chagrin
headline.main: Spurs Coach Puts His Team First, Much to Commissioner’s Chagrin
headline.print_headline: Spurs Coach’s Challenge Puts His Team First
